comments.commentBody:
The Obama health plan was actually a Heritage Foundation plan. http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/statements/2010/apr/01/barack-ob...

While Obama tried to pass himself off as a liberal when he was looking for support among liberals, he's actually as conservative as the Republicans on many issues, including health care.

Bill Moyers said that Obama wasn't forced into this conservative plan, this is the plan he wanted. He wasn't bought by the health care industry, he's one of them.
America will fall out of the global economy before it realizes its medical funding system destroys its competitiveness.

I do not grasp why we have this strange law, except to protect the interests of the healthcare insurance industry. The direct way would be to mandate a universal basic single pay system under normal taxation.

The arguments will probably be interesting and one hopes the same for the opinion(s).

This is a historic moment in oceanic exploration, as import as the first explorations in space by manned space ships.
James Cameron deserves to be near the top of the list of great explorers.
Congratulations.

You don't vote in methods you can't assure fairness.
The NDP has overstepped its ability to ensure a its elections if its possible to suffer from DOS attack.

I love the NDP but it looks dumb in this matter.

To Rance: thought we were a community of NY Times readers with diverse views, many of us paid-up subscribers of both print version (for decades) and electronic version (all versions that have been offered, for as long as they've been offered).

I've been posting to these comment threads (and, yes, as an out-of-the-closet Republican) since the threads opened up, and may have the record for number of "Editors Selections", "Highlights", or, as they're called these days, "Picks", over all those years.

You don't have to buy what I sell, particularly as I'm not selling anything here -- I'm agreeing or disagreeing with "Opinion"; and in this particular response, was disagreeing forcefully with one columnist's views. What's more, I'm hardly the only Republican posting here.

Maybe some others would care to opine on the right of any of us to give our opinion here, provided it satisfies the NY Times's moderation criteria.

.

Maybe you should consider how Democrats feel about Citizens United. It seems to me that Rachel Maddow makes reasoned arguments about the merits of each side of an issue. She will happily argue with any conservative pundit or pol on the merits of the issues. I don't imagine even the most partisan follower of Fox News would ever assert that they make reasoned arguments on the merits of the issue. The level of discourse of Fox is comical.

Fox News and the entire rightwing have basically proven Orwell right.

How are you ever going to resolve the conflict between your pseudo-Darwinian "Free market" and the reality of "Entrenched Money Buying Influence"?

There's a seed of Nietzsche and exceptionalism in your notion of the "free market". Its a free market where some start "Freer" than others.

"Free Market" Capitalism, "Fundamentalist" Christianity, and "Representative" Democracy are in a fist fight inside the Republican party. I don't think we really know what the words in quotations mean anymore. Adam Smith, Jesus Christ, and George Washington seemed to have been scrambled up in how they're guideposts to a civil and just society.
Freethinking people don't like to belong to groups.

Stink Tanks and Pink Slime. With the aid of our nicely compensated corporatist Democrats in both houses of congress we are lucky to even have schools.

Public education is the cornerstone of continued Democracy, self determination or whatever you prefer to call it. Charter schools, home schooled, (check out Art Robinson's curriculum) and how many parents are ripping off tax payers like Santorum was.

Fifteen million a day tune in to no IQ Limbaugh and idiot Beck and no amount of fact or logic will counter the misinformation. Though I have not noticed much of an effort, just more weaseling, pandering and wheeling and dealing on all sides.
Thank you for encapsulating what is going on in such a clear and concise way.
Perhaps, but his essay wasn't about managing a company in today's regulatory environment. Anything else you want to attack him for not pretending to know?
The saddest part of the tale is a president who responds to social media outrage. A symptom of weak leadership and a lame reelection strategy.

Hey, how do you like the horse race, food fight no issue, or policy discussion in the Times.

Polls, gaffes, reporters opinions and then highly filtered presentations of fact.

There are, considering that they are kept off the air in many major markets and off all but very few of the most powerful transmitters. You can drive across country and hear nothing but wall-to-wall conservative talk. Conservative talk shows with dismal ratings stay on the air on stations which would not dream of carrying liberal programming.

Conglomerate ownership has a lot to do with it. Clear Channel stations are obliged to carry Limbaugh and pay a hefty fee to boot, in order to help pay for Limbaugh's $50 million annual contract his syndication, Premiere Networks. Oh yes, Premiere is owned by Clear Channel and Clear Channel is owned by Bain Capital, of Mitt Romney fame.

The broadcast airwaves are under almost as much of a one-party monopoly as Radio Moscow in the USSR. The best way to free yourself from such a monopoly if you have high-speed internet service is to get yourself two or three WiFi radios around the house.

The Democratic leadership is so dumb and spineless all it can do is read polls and hide in its mouse hole hoping to not offend the swing voters.

The result is that they have surrendered all debate, the defining and articulation of the issues to the right wing army of disinformation.
Hmmmmmmm. Really? Sarah Palin swithced my vote. And my wife's

@sick of it - Would you also say that Tucker motors went out of business because "nobody liked them"? Or would you agree that it just might be possible that smaller companies like Tucker (like DeSoto, like AMC et al) might have had monopolistic collusion from the big three working to take them down, rather than pure free-market performance? In other words, does the free market system always and absolutely operate with 100% fairness?

If you say "yes it does", you're being disingenuous.

What is the differnce between blaming Bush or the Rejpublicans or conservatives...Always the same blame game...You guys have all the power and you make the mess worse...simple fact failure is hard to accept, and if you can blame someone elase or some thing, you do it...and Obama is the master blame setter...isn't he???
Just like kids who will not accept their defeats and just offer excuses...grow up and ralize we need new leadership...most are ready for AOB Anyone but Obama
Whinning only entertains for seconds

So why do so many non-rich vote for them? Some of their strongest precincts are in places like Kiryas Joel,  NY, which is also very high on the food stamp and Section 8 housing voucher list (on  a per capita basis). There are lots of intolerant religious folks in this country and they are not all Evangelical Christians. The people get the government they deserve.

I agree with everything you say, except change Democrats for the Republican word in your statement and you have it right...Look who your friends are...Bill Maher, Jand Fonda,
Sean Penn, Alex Baldwin, bill Ayers, Rev. Wright, Farakahn, and all those fundamentally sane Hollywood types that are so stable..And your nominees have been great...Al Dracula Gore, John Heinz Kerry, and the ever faithful John Edwards.....

Because the right wing hosts rely on fomenting emotional responses from their audience.

The "liberals" tend to be more thoughtful and less knee-jerk reactors. (I know, not all!)

It is difficult to actually come up with real solutions to real problems. Difficult to have an adult conversation. The right (Rush, etc.) doesn't try.

Best bumper-sticker ever:
"Vote Republican, it's easier than thinking."

When Ted Kennedy died (which people weren't prepared for), the law had to go in as it was at that point via reconcilation since Scott Brown replaced him. Republicans could and would filibuster Obamacare.
mford..exactly right.  Instead of doing that, obama created a law that is an expensive mess and it will be struck down.

One can only wonder what all these lawyers would be doing now if Congress and the President had listened to the majority of Americans (60-75% according to polls at the time) who expressed desire for a single payer, universal healthcare system. What if Obama had used all that political capital, combined with majorities in both houses, to ram through universal coverage. Who would be complaining now, besides health insurers?

While I agree with your overall thoughts wholeheartedly, I do hope that appearances ("the innocence and openness that emanates from the photo", and "his kindness and gentle nature is depicted in his face") have absolutely nothing to do with justice.

Like all bullies, Zimmerman is a coward.
He was attacked by the boy??
Zimmerman is a creep and a murderer.

Judy Crane, before shooting from the lip please try to understand the difference between race and ethnicity. Racially, Zimmerman is white. Ethnically, he is Hispanic, or Latino. This case stinks to high heaven of racial profiling and you smell the roses. Well, those roses are blood red, and they adorn the grave of a nice kid who was the target of a white vigilante.

I think that this tragedy is made more compelling because of the innocence and openness that emanates from the photo of Travon Martin.

All of the reminiscences of his mother depicting his kindness and gentle nature is depicted in his face and is why I feel the murder of Travon Martin will be a symbol for people to coalesce around both to get justice for him and his family but also to oppose the racial fear mongering spread by the Republican party as reflected in their voter suppression laws, inane and mindless "hold your ground" laws. the increased diluting of of gun control laws, and their policy proposals aimed at gutting programs that primarily serve people of color.

This is the most sickening event I can remember in years, rivaling in infamy the murder of Emmett Till, the Birmingham church bombing and the murder of the the three civil rights workers in Philadelphia Mississippi.

Just witnessing the grief of Travon Martin's parents on TV and and how they have maintained their composure and dignity in public despite their indescribable suffering is both heartbreaking and also makes my blood boil.

This was a good and decent young man murdered by an insecure wannabe cop without the abilities to become one, who felt emboldened by an insane law enacted to pander to right wing extremist citizens and politicians bought off by the NRA lobby and right wing Koch brothers funded organizations like ALEC.

There are more people than Zimmerman with blood on their hands.

Kacee - anyone that critiques the NYT must be "Fox news biased?" I agree that Fox news is biased -- I don't listen to it. I do read the NYT, but I find it, too, is biased, and extremely so.

LG -- As for those in academia being the most intelligent among us, don't forget the aphorism, "those who can't do, teach." Tell Bill Gates, Steve Jobs, and others that academics are smarter than them. As for liberal views being adopted by those who have "wider perspectives and deeper thinking," your attribution of such wisdom to those under 30 belies itself and is without need of refutation. Liberal views are adopted by those with narrow self interests (i.e., those on the public dole), and dreamers (often the young). Sure, we need dreamers, but in time they will temper their dreams with the hard realities years of experience will give them, and then they will come more to the center of the road. Of course, there are always those who will remain forever liberal, and such people are those who, in the thinking of Jonathan Haidt, score lower on measures of "respect," "loyalty," and "purity." Disrespect, disloyalty, and impurity pretty much make up the core of your sacred liberal philosophies. And Jonathan Haidt is a renowned liberal philospher-TEDster.

There are many reasons, but the liberals I know don't subscribe to group think and have the ability and eagerness to decide for themselves. The success of the GOP lies not in their overarching ability to communicate better of more succinctly but in reaching that great swath of America who is unable/unwilling to make the effort to become informed. The Conservative media largely panders to the instincts of the uninformed and fearful They are masters of conflation and hyperbole Please do not succumb to equating success with truth.
